patch.description:
Updates a Application object.

In the case which the appplication is paused then the allowed attributes for updating are:

 `availability_status`, `availability_status_error`, `last_available_at` and `last_checked_at`

get.description: Returns an array of Authentication objects

Returns an Authentication object

patch.description:
Updates an Authentication object.

In the case of the authentication being paused, the allowed attributes to be updated are:

 `availability_status`, `availability_status_error`, `last_checked_at` and `last_available_at`

get.description: Returns an array of Endpoint objects
Returns an Endpoint object

patch.description:
Updates a Endpoint object.

In the case of the endpoint being paused, the allowed attributes to be updated are:

 `availability_status`, `availability_status_error`, `last_checked_at` and `last_available_at`

patch.description:
Updates a Source object.

In the case of the source being paused, the allowed attributes to be updated are:

 `availability_status`, `last_checked_at` and `last_available_at`

400.description: Bad request. Please check that the source is not paused since you might be trying to update unpermitted parameters.

endpoints.description: Array of endpoint objects to create. The operation looks up the parent source by the `source_name` attribute so the `source_name` must match one of the `source`'s names in the payload.

source_name.description: The name of the source this endpoint will be attached to

host.description: URI host component of the endpoint.

path.description: URI path component of the endpoint.

port.description: URI port component of the endpoint.

scheme.description: URI scheme component of the endpoint.

verify_ssl.description: Should the SSL certificate be verified?

applications.description: Array of application objects to create. The operation looks up the parent Source by the `source_name` attribute so the `source_name` must match one of the `source` names in the payload. You can specify the application type by using either the `application_type_name` or the `application_type_id`.

source_name.description: The name of the source this application will be attached to

source_id.description: The ID of the soruce this application will be attached to

application_type_name.description: The name of the application type

application_type_id.description: The ID of the application type

extra.description: Any extra information you would like to store in JSON format

authentications.description:
Array of authentications to create. `resource_type` tells the action where to look for the parent, must be either application, endpoint or source.
If the parent is a source, it looks up by name. If the parent is an endpoint, it looks up via host so the hostname must match. If the parent is an application, it looks up via application type so the value must match the application type which matches.

authtype.description: The type of the authentication. You can find this by listing the source types or the application types

resource_name.description: The name of the resource this authentication relates to

resource_type.description: The type of the resource this authentication relates to

extra.description: Any extra information you would like to store in JSON format

sources.description: An array containing the created sources

endpoints.description: An array containing the created endpoints

applications.description: An array containing the created applications

authentications.description: An array containing the created authentications
